short_summary: Demolition of old crib on Biolog Island
full_summary:
# LL 5034 DB-CD3 Biolog Island Crib Demolition

## Project Overview

The Fisheries and Oceans Canada department is inviting qualified contractors to submit a request for qualification (RFQ) to demolish an existing wood crib at Biolog Island (LL 5034). The crib, estimated to be 6 feet long by 6 feet wide by 3 feet high, is located in the Southeastern part of Georgian Bay and is accessible only by water. The demolition project is expected to take approximately one day and must be completed by September 27, 2024.

## Scope of Work

The successful contractor will be responsible for:

* Mobilizing to the site with a work barge of appropriate size and certification
* Demolishing the existing wood crib, associated rock, and submerged supports
* Cutting and removing any remaining rebar and reinforcements connected to the rock below
* Demobilizing from the site
* Disposing of all waste at a licensed waste disposal facility
* Implementing a detailed Environmental Protection Plan, which will account for various items listed in the specifications and the demolition of the structure

## Technical Requirements

The RFQ package includes detailed specifications outlining the technical requirements of the project, including the demolition of the crib, handling of materials, and environmental protection measures.

## Important Dates

* Closing date of the bid: June 17, 2024
* Delayed date of the bid: 7 days before the closing date

## Contracting Information

The contracting authority is Fisheries and Oceans Canada. Interested contractors can contact Paul Fortier at paul.fortier@dfo-mpo.gc.ca or (343) 596-9926 for any inquiries.

## Documentation

The RFQ package can be downloaded from the following links:

* [English version](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/38881/30005830-request-for-qualification-en.pdf)
* [French version](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/38881/30005830-request-for-qualification-fr.pdf)

Please note that all inquiries must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority no later than 7 calendar days before the closing date, and may not be responded to after that time.
